topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5372ec206368726a9cab0600#post_5372ec206368726a9cab0600
Time will tell. I'd be interested to see a Jurassic Park movie that just once does not have something to enrage me.

In the first it did three things I hate: 1.) Allowing Jeff Goldblum to talk (full disclosure: I only like him in the Fly) 2.) a mind blowingly hypocritical anticapitalist bit from Hammond where he decries the lawyer's suggestion about how much they can charge to visit Jurassic Park, 3.) just once I'd like to see a movie where at the start someone express a dislike or disinterest in having kids and is allowed to keep that attitude. Just once.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body: Apparently, there will be a scene with three extras being chased by a _Tyrannosaurus_, and a petting zoo scene with a baby _Triceratops_, along with a "new, terrifying dinosaur" (identity unknown). Actors include Omar Sy, Bryce Dallas Howard, Andy Buckley, Judy Greer and Chris Pratt, among a few others.
